The Vet Kennel
At a glance:
  • Key signs: Continuous left basilar murmur, bounding pulses, ± mitral regurgitation.
  • Dx: Echo (LA/LV enlargement, continuous PA flow, funnel-shaped PDA), X‑ray overcirculation, BP ↓ diastolic.
  • Tx: Early closure (device or surgical). Manage CHF if present.

You’ve probably heard the term “PDA” thrown around in cardiology lectures...

This article breaks it down simply and clearly for vet students.
